thread.title: German Parliament Approves Third Greek Bailout
thread.title_full: German Parliament Approves Third Greek Bailout

title: German Parliament Approves Third Greek Bailout
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Wed, Aug 19, 2015, 12:02 BST - UK Markets close in 4 hrs 28 mins German Parliament Approves Third Greek Bailout By (c) Sky News 2015 | Sky News – 17 minutes ago 

German MPs have overwhelmingly approved a third bailout deal for Greece, despite opposition from some conservative politicians. 
The final vote was 454-113, with 18 politicians choosing to abstain, following concern that Chancellor Angela Merkel could face dissent from conservatives in her ruling bloc. 
German Finance Minister Wolfgang Schaeuble said earlier today that it would be “irresponsible” for his fellow MPs to reject the bailout, as it was an opportunity to “seize the chance” for a new beginning in Greece. 
The package, worth €86bn (£61bn), will be paid in instalments spread over the next three years. 
The first payment will total €26bn; €10bn will be used to recapitalise the Greek banking system and the remaining €16bn, paid in parts, will largely go towards repaying debts. 
It (Other OTC: ITGL - news ) has been agreed that €13bn will be released by August 20, as Greece is due to make a repayment of €3.2bn – which has risen to closer to €3.4bn once interest has been taken into account – to the European Central Bank (ECB).
